title: If I can write my film story as a story, but I don't know how to write it as a screenplay, what should I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would highly recommend reading “Save the Cat” by Blake Snyder. He really breaks down the entire process in a way that is easy to understand. Alternatively, you can also hire someone to write your screenplay for you (based on your ideas). It’s a service my company provides and is very popular! But, either way, reading “Save the Cat” is a good start that I would recommend doing no matter what you choose.

My suggestions: Take one or more screenwriting courses - This will help to teach you story structure, pacing and character development. While you are taking the courses or afterward, try to apply what you have learned to the stories that you have in mind.Read as many screenplays as you can - Study them closely and determine which among has a structure, narrative flow and pacing that you see fits your writing style. Adapt your current stories accordingly.
